description:
"I can succeed as a Private Client Operations Associate at Capital Group."

The Private Client Operations Associate plays a crucial role in facilitating the vision of the Private Operations Team. This multifaceted position encompasses critical aspects such as account opening, account maintenance, cash processing, security transfers, record retention, and alternative processing.

Key Responsibilities

  • Facilitating Team Vision Supports the Private Operations Team's vision by handling various critical tasks, including focus areas in account opening, account maintenance, cash processing, security transfers, record retention, and alternative processing.
  • Demonstrating Expertise Exhibits comprehensive knowledge in the assigned area(s), ensuring a high level of proficiency and accuracy in all tasks.
  • Task Ownership Assumes full responsibility for assigned work, ensuring tasks are completed with precision and punctuality, including but not limited to emails and workflows.
  • Independent Production Manages production work with added complexity autonomously, requiring minimal guidance from seniors, specialists, or managers.
  • Continuous Improvement Actively seeks out and identifies gaps and opportunities for enhancement in resources, processes, and technology.
  • Communication Consistently keeps the manager informed about individual progress, capacity, and potential challenges.
  • Time Allocation Allocates 80% of the time to production in assigned workflow tasks, 10% to managing emails and other inquiries, 5% to training and reviewing materials, and 5% to participating in meetings.

"I am the person Capital Group is looking for."

  • Demonstrates initiative by identifying issues.
  • Demonstrates ability to prioritize their individual work and ensures it's completed in a timely and accurate manner.
  • Demonstrates flexibility and agility.
  • Demonstrates intellectual curiosity and analytical skills.
  • Demonstrates the ability to work effectively in a team environment.
  • Demonstrates the ability to collaborate, develop and maintain working relationships inside and outside the organization to enable effective completion of business objectives.
  • Demonstrate ability to remain calm, composed, and positive during peak seasons or stressful situations.

Orange County Base Salary Range $71,425-$114,280

In addition to a highly competitive base salary, per plan guidelines, restrictions and vesting requirements, you also will be eligible for an individual annual performance bonus, plus Capital's annual profitability bonus plus a retirement plan where Capital contributes 15% of your eligible earnings.

You can learn more about our compensation and benefits here .

  • Temporary positions in Canada and the United States are excluded from the above mentioned compensation and benefit plans.

We are an equal opportunity employer, which means we comply with all federal, state and local laws that prohibit discrimination when making all decisions about employment. As equal opportunity employers, our policies prohibit unlawful discrimination on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, ancestry, sex (including gender and gender identity), pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, age, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, marital status, sexual orientation, citizenship status, AIDS/HIV status, political activities or affiliations, military or veteran status, status as a victim of domestic violence, assault or stalking or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law.
